workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 6.1 - Mend
workout_file.description: An active recovery workout featuring high cadence intervals.

textevent.message: We have a very easy day planned for today, let's get into it!
Aim for 85-95 RPM here, and make sure you have some fluids, your fan on, and a towel handy.
Just a couple more minutes to go here and we'll settle into a steady pace.
Active recovery days are important to loosen the legs, but the key here is to not fatigue them.
So, if you just aren't feeling it today at any point, feel free to hop off the trainer and enjoy the rest of your day.
And, most importantly, respect the power targets and do not overshoot them, no matter how good you feel.
Today is meant to be easy to allow your body to respond and adapt to the previous training.
Let's not mess that process up, shall we? :-)
30sec easy peasy, then we'll steady it out..
Okay, steady as you go now. Keep that pedaling fast and light here and aim for around 95 RPM.
Let the other riders pass you, don't pay any attention to the races, just focus on freshening up those legs.
Sometimes it's more difficult to go easy than it is hard, but have the mental strength to keep it really light.
Coming up, we are going to do a few fast cadence efforts to continue to loosen those muscles up, BUT NOT FATIGUE THEM.
We start at 1 minute steady at 100 RPM, then ramp up to 110+ RPM for 30 seconds.
We will spend 5min super easy between focusing on keeping that cadence light and quick just like we're doing here.
Get ready, start bringing up that cadence to 100+ RPM.
All right, just a bit more effort now, FAST FEET!
In 10 seconds, get ready to bring that cadence up to 110+ RPM and slightly lift the power.
SPIN! No bouncing in that saddle though.
Good work! We are going to do a few more of those today to further loosen the legs up.
For the next little bit though, back to super light and quick spinning. Again aim for 95 RPM.
We are going into another fast cadence effort in 10 seconds, start spinning those legs up to 100+ RPM again.
Lift the power just a touch, really quick feet here.
In 10 seconds, get ready to bring that cadence up to 110+ RPM and slightly ramp up the effort
GO GO GO! Keep your form solid here.
Way to go! We are going to do 2 more of those today.
Remember, if you are ever not feeling it today, feel free to hop off the trainer and cut this short.
We are going into another fast cadence effort in 10 seconds, start spinning those legs up to 100+ RPM again
Bring the effort up again now.
Fast feet coming up next! Ready?
UP UP UP!
Beautiful! Just 1 more of those to go, and we're DONE!
We are going into another fast cadence effort in 10 seconds, start spinning those legs up to 100+ RPM again
All right, just a bit more effort now, really quick feet here.
In 10 seconds, get ready to bring that cadence up to 110+ RPM and slightly ramp up the effort
QUICK FEET! No bouncing in that saddle though.
And just like that, we're DONE! Way to go. Thank you for respecting the power targets and keeping it really easy today.
See you next time :-)
